name: World Students' Day
description: Many people including politicians and officials in India have been spreading that the UN has declared the birthday of former Indian President A. P. J. Abdul Kalam as World Students' Day. But the UN has declared 15 October as World Students' Day For the last few years even those who have held important positions in India have been spreading and celebrating it, everyone knows how it originated. Rajiv Chandran, UN Information Center for India and Bhutan National Information Officer, told a national media that the United Nations had made such a statement. October 15 has been declared World Student\u2019s day on the official website of the United Nations. If the United Nations is to make an official announcement on any given day, it must be requested to the General Assembly by one member state and then discussed and voted on. This has happened in terms of celebrating Kalam's birthday as World Student Day.
